definition: to beat/to strike/to hit/to break/to type/to mix up/to build/to fight/to fetch/to make/to tie up/to issue/to shoot/to calculate/to play (a game)/since/from
to retreat/to decline/to move back/to withdraw
lit. to beat the return drum (idiom)/fig. to give up/to turn tail

sentences.english: Its final aim was to repulse the third anti-communist upsurge launched by the KMT diehards.
sentences.chinese: 其最終目的是打退國民黨頑固派發起的三次反共高潮。

sentences.english: We've signed an agreement and we can't back out of it now.
sentences.chinese: 我們已經簽訂了協議，現在可不能打退堂鼓。

sentences.english: Don't beat a retreat immediately after any setback, at least you should make another attempt to hit it.
sentences.chinese: 不要一遇到挫折就打退堂鼓，至少你應該再試一次。

sentences.english: We thought he had decided but then he pulled back.
sentences.chinese: 我們原以爲他已經決定，但後來他又打退堂鼓了。

sentences.english: He carries a gun to fight off Indians and cattle thieves.
sentences.chinese: 他僅用手槍就能打退印第安人和盜馬賊的侵犯。

sentences.english: Our frontier guards, fighting in self-defence, threw back the invading troops.
sentences.chinese: 我邊防戰士在自衛戰中打退了入侵的軍隊。

sentences.english: Armed only with appear, he drove off five of his attackers.
sentences.chinese: 只有一支矛槍作爲武器，他打退了五個進攻者。

sentences.english: The soldiers beat off all the enemy attacks.
sentences.chinese: 戰士們打退了敵人的所有進攻。

sentences.english: It's too late to back down now.
sentences.chinese: 現在打退堂鼓已經太晚了。

sentences.english: He personally held out against 14 human-wave attacks.
sentences.chinese: 他曾經在戰鬥中打退過蘇軍14次人海衝擊。

sentences.english: He beat back his enemies; he put them to everlasting shame.
sentences.chinese: 他就打退了他的敵人，叫他們永蒙羞辱。

sentences.english: The site fought off a similar attack two weeks ago, he said.
sentences.chinese: 他還說網站兩個星期前剛打退了一次類似的襲擊。

sentences.english: Some of what we eat on a daily basis excretes back out via our pores.
sentences.chinese: 有的每天喫什麼，我們就通過我們的孔蜜打退堂鼓。

sentences.english: Scar face people back Chen men, and Chen singled out face to face.
sentences.chinese: 疤臉人打退陳大的手下，和陳大面對面單挑。

sentences.english: They promised to cut taxes, but they're beginning to backpedal now.
sentences.chinese: 他們答應要減稅，現在卻開始打退堂鼓。

definition: to annihilate/to wipe out completely/to exterminate
to run off rebuffed/to fend off/(to fight off and make sb) run off
to besiege/to beleaguer/to attack from all sides/to jointly speak or write against sb
